job_title: Unarmed Security Officer in Houston, TX
pros: Methodist West Hospital has edify my security experience
cons: Working in Methodist Hospital exposed my experience greatly

pros: they do bonus hours. so if u do overtime. u get 8 dollars plus your base pay per hour. so my check was lovely..
cons: Methodist do not care what you are going through. They have a strict NO EXCUSE policy. My uncle died and I got wrote up for not coming in. I actually missed his wake. If I couldn't find nobody to replace me the day of his funeral. then I was going to get wrote up again. Methodist has a 6 months probation if you miss 3 days reguardless if u got a doctor excuse or not. U FIRED!!! I almost didn't make it. My daughter was in a car wreck and I left work, guess what I got wrote up again!!! I even had her hospital papers they didn't care.  OH YES... most important if u resign, like I did U FORFIT your PTO.. IF u get terminated YOU FORFIT your PTO as well. Methodist is strict and don't CARE.. IF u go to work all the time without no call in then u will not have no problems

pros: There's opportunity to move to other departments and learn new skills.
cons: A lot of lazy RNs.  If your nurse tech is busy assisting patient A, it's rude to ask them to get patient B a cup if ice particularly if you have to pass the ice machine to deliver the message.  A little common sense and basic nursing care goes a long way.

job_title: Emergency Room RN in San Antonio, TX
pros: Very busy. Never know what is coming through the door next.
cons: Team cohesiveness is questionable(must be party person to fit in). More interested in getting pts in and out than quality of care. Much prejudice against older seasoned nurses. Many nurses play "leap frog" and don't speak to their team mates...instead go completely over the chain of command to the director with insinuations. Management listens to gossip instead of looking at the facts.

job_title: Clinical Nutrition Assistant in Houston, TX
pros: You get to actually help and work with patients in their time of need.
cons: You have to be careful not to judge people because of the state of mind they're in.Everyone who goes to the hospital are not   really sick so you can't look at everyone like they have something really serious and treat them like they are disgusting.

job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Merrillville, IN
pros: I see no pros anymore after what they did to me
cons: I was hired and started working here, on my 2nd day of employment I was hit by a car and was in the hospital when I was let go by the hospital. I understood being let go for not being able to do the job they hired me for, and I was in a probation period, but when I called back when I was healed to see if I could reapply for another position the HR contact said shed check into it, and never called me back. I no longer want to work for a company that has no compassion for it's employees. I wonder how they really feel about their patients.

review_title: Wonderful people, flaws like any place else
pros: Senior Executives truly care about their employees. Good benefits, great childcare, CEO really stands by mission. It's truly a community hospital that cares about local businesses and people's livelihoods. A lot of leaders are passionate about the patients' care and the employees' experiences.
cons: Attendance policy is strict. As with any other public service institution, there are flaws and frustrations, and occacional bad seeds, however there are very few places left that allow you to feel part of a greater good.

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Missouri City, TX
pros: I'm a go getter and very positive, great personally, I work well with others I always have in my past experience. I have passion for helping people anyway I can to make like better for them, I'm always on time for work and do not mind working overtime if needed.
cons: Just missing out on be a stay a home mother but my children all are at great ages

review_title: They will deny your request for unemployment!
pros: The unexpected bonuses, bus pass, convent area to work.
cons: Do not work for this company! If your family member gets sick and you haven't been on the job for more then one year you won't qualify for FMLA if you should have to resign, which only leave's one option for you to apply for unemployment benefits. Something that Methodist will deny you for, but yet they claim to follow the "ICARE" values!

pros: It's a good place to work, everybody helps each other when needed. We greeted each other with a smile, their was team work on matter where you work or what you may have been doing at the time.
cons: I myself didn't like the second sift, to much work for one person I clean three areas including high and low dust was responsible for ten rooms and discharges, in the ICU. Not enough employee to go around.

pros: Great co-workers, benefits are good, PTO is reasonable. Flexible scheduling. Good place to get a wide variety of nursing skills.
cons: management doesn't listen to employees, but I tend to see this as a problem with many companies. I do believe they are working on change

pros: Great teamwork, patient load 16 patient for cna.nice amount of supplies. Coworker support each other well. CNA all wear same color uniforms also every department  wears different color. CNA are not flowed to often.
cons: Up management works as team, even though  it's union in place. Reason most CNA leave is attendance  policy and case load of 16 patients for 12 hours continuous.

job_title: Staff RN in Sugar Land, TX
pros: Great reputation, excellent standards, policies.
cons: 12 hour shifts, too many rules with new ones being cranked out daily.  Employees encouraged to report one another.  Supervisors listen outside patient rooms to employee's interactions with patient.  We need more help on the floors, stop rushing nurses to take patients at unsafe times.

review_title: I have had a wonderful experience

cons: The only thing i dislike  is there is not alot of opportunities for over time.

review_title: A great place for a job, but not for a career.
pros: Family like environment;  flexible scheduling;  great benefits;  good place to gain experience;
cons: Poor communication;  little appreciation shown towards employees;

pros: Great staff, helpful management, good work environment for nurses overall.   It was great working with a dedicated team, and there was a lot of opportunity for nurses at the hospital.
cons: For a new employee you did not get priority in shifts over the older nursing staff.

pros: the employer takes the workers as his own family. a lot of patient appreciation bonus

pros: I was treated with the utmost respect. They have wonderful career advancement opportunities, great benefits, try to accompany all of your needs, and they are very professional.

pros: the benefits were excellent the Methodist brand is great ...
